duties_responsibilities.duty: Develops and maintains nursing practice standards of care for a specific transplant population.
Serves as a liaison and provides consultation and education services to support standards of care.
Coordinates donor procurement and recipient preparation.
Participates in the development of policies and procedures pertinent to the transplant program.
Participates and develops appropriate educational programs for end-stage organ disease patients and families, nursing staff, and medical staff.
Serves as a resource person to all staff involved in the care of transplant patients and their families.
Maintains communication with referring physicians and insurance case managers, providing necessary information and records.
Coordinates the flow of patients from initial referral, through evaluation and education, to post-transplant follow-up and referral back to the community.
Maintains UNOS waiting list, completes required TIEDI forms, and manages internal departmental database.
Oversees the assignments delegated to support staff and evaluates their performance.
Functions independently within clinical skills and established processes for patient flow.
Attends department quality meetings, participates in department QAPI activities, and may be required to be on call 24 hours a day.

education_certification.credential: Basic Life Support (BLS) Healthcare Provider certification from American Heart Association
